intro: Claoxylon tenerifolium subsp. tenerifolium, commonly known as the Canary Island ebony, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
